sentences.english: We are gonna publish their ugly faces.
sentences.chinese: 我們要把他們的醜惡嘴臉公佈於衆。

sentences.english: This is the history of the common features of Rigoletto.
sentences.chinese: 這是歷代弄臣的共同嘴臉。

sentences.english: The science has caught up and the shamans are exposed.
sentences.chinese: 科學已經迎頭趕上，巫師的醜惡嘴臉終被曝光。

sentences.english: Not all investors are like that.
sentences.chinese: 當然，並非所有投資者都是這副嘴臉。

sentences.english: That is trivial looks penurious of looking at be pressed by his under dictate woman.
sentences.chinese: 那猥瑣的嘴臉，貪婪的看着被他手下壓着得女子。

sentences.english: His servile expression of praise for his employer was disgusting to me.
sentences.chinese: 他奉承僱主的那副卑屈的嘴臉令我噁心。

sentences.english: It's because we Russians saw the ugly face of the West.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲我們俄羅斯人看到西方的醜惡嘴臉。

sentences.english: I remember his fatuous and limited face on the field of Austerlitz.
sentences.chinese: 我記得那副在奧斯特利茨戰場的自鳴得意的嘴臉。

definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
